label: assumption-regularity-summary
title: Summary of Regularity Assumptions
nl_summary: This assumption catalog details the necessary regularity conditions for the components of the coupled mean-field system to ensure well-posedness. Key requirements include $C^2$ boundaries for domains, $C^2$ potential for a globally Lipschitz force field, and sufficient smoothness/measurability for flow fields and algorithmic functions.

bullet_items.name: H1
bullet_items.text: The domains $X_{\text{valid}}$ and $V_{\text{alg}}$ are bounded and have smooth ($C^2$) boundaries.

bullet_items.name: H2
bullet_items.text: The reward potential $R_{\text{pos}}$ is $C^2$, making the force field $F$ globally Lipschitz.

bullet_items.name: H3
bullet_items.text: The flow field $u$ is $C^1$, and all physical parameters ($m, \gamma_{\text{fric}}, \Theta, \sigma_x$) are finite and positive.

bullet_items.name: H4
bullet_items.text: All algorithmic functions (e.g., the rescale function, companion selection) are measurable and satisfy the continuity properties established in the abstract framework.

bullet_items.name: H5
bullet_items.text: The killing rate function $c(z)$ is smooth ($C^\infty$), non-negative, and has compact support in a neighborhood of $\partial X_{\text{valid}}$.

conditions.text: The physical parameters ($m, \gamma_{\text{fric}}, \Theta, \sigma_x$) are finite and positive.
$c(z)$ has compact support in a neighborhood of $\partial X_{\text{valid}}$

notes.text: These assumptions are satisfied by the Canonical Euclidean Gas.

label: assump-domain-regularity
title: Regularity of the Valid Domain
nl_summary: The valid position domain $X_{\text{valid}} \subset \mathbb{R}^d$ is assumed to be an open, bounded domain with a $C^3$ boundary. Furthermore, its signed distance function is $C^2$ near the boundary, which allows for the definition of the unit inward normal vector.

bullet_items.name: Smoothness
bullet_items.text: $X_{\text{valid}}$ is an open, bounded domain with $C^3$ boundary $\partial X_{\text{valid}}$.
bullet_items.latex: $X_{\text{valid}}$ is an open, bounded domain with $C^3$ boundary $\partial X_{\text{valid}}$.

bullet_items.name: Distance Function
bullet_items.text: The signed distance function $d(x) := \text{dist}(x, \partial X_{\text{valid}})$ is $C^2$ in a tubular neighborhood $\mathcal{T}_\delta := \{x \in X_{\text{valid}} : d(x) < \delta\}$ for some $\delta > 0$.
bullet_items.latex: The signed distance function $d(x) := \text{dist}(x, \partial X_{\text{valid}})$ is $C^2$ in a tubular neighborhood $\mathcal{T}_\delta := \{x \in X_{\text{valid}} : d(x) < \delta\}$ for some $\delta > 0$.

bullet_items.name: Unit Inward Normal
bullet_items.text: For each $x \in \mathcal{T}_\delta$, let $n_x(x) = -\nabla d(x)$ denote the unit inward normal vector (pointing into $X_{\text{valid}}$).
bullet_items.latex: For each $x \in \mathcal{T}_\delta$, let $n_x(x) = -\nabla d(x)$ denote the unit inward normal vector (pointing into $X_{\text{valid}}$).

label: assumption-integrator-regularity
title: Regularity of the Discrete Integrator
nl_summary: This assumption specifies the functional form of the position update $x^+(\tau; x,v)$ generated by the discrete kinetic integrator, specifically the BAOAB method. The update includes position, velocity, force contribution, and a remainder term $R_{\text{pos}}$.

bullet_items.name: Position Update Formula
bullet_items.text: The discrete kinetic integrator (BAOAB) produces position updates of the form: $x^+(\tau; x,v) = x + v\tau + \frac{\tau^2}{2m}F(x) + R_{\text{pos}}(\tau; x,v)$
bullet_items.latex: x^+(\tau; x,v) = x + v\tau + \frac{\tau^2}{2m}F(x) + R_{\text{pos}}(\tau; x,v)

label: assump-density-regularity-killing
title: Density Regularity
nl_summary: The phase-space density $f^\tau(x,v)$ at the beginning of a discrete timestep is assumed to be bounded in $L^\infty(\Omega)$ by $M_f$ and spatially regular, specifically $C^1(\Omega)$ with its spatial gradient bounded in $L^\infty$ by $M_{\nabla f}$.

parameters.description: Upper bound for the $L^\infty$ norm of the density.
Upper bound for the $L^\infty$ norm of the spatial gradient of the density.
